alert.note: Alert for Coffee (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 04 at 3:13AM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Middle Tennessee, including the following county, Coffee. * WHEN...Until 600 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 312 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms moving across Coffee County. Radar estimates up to 2 inches of rain has fallen in southern portions of the county in the past hour, including around Tullahoma. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Manchester, Tullahoma, Hillsboro and Summitville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
